results.title: Speedy
results.creator_credit: Harold Lloyd Corporation and Ted Wilde
results.brief_description: Harold Lloyd’s last silent work and the only one shot entirely on location in New York, tells of Harold ‘Speedy’ Swift’s efforts to save the last horse-drawn streetcar line in New York from the machinations of some traction magnates. He has to surmount all sorts of obstacles to do so including getting ‘Babe’ Ruth to his baseball on time. The end-of-an-era plot line must have partly reflected Lloyd’s feelings towards the introduction of sound to the movies. With an orchestral score performed by The Live Cinema Orchestra. Cast also includes Ann Christy and Burt Woodruffe.

results.title: Speedway
results.creator_credit: Douglas Laurence, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and Norman Taurog
results.brief_description: All Steve Grayson (Elvis Presley) wants to do is drive cars and win. The only problem is his gambling manager has lost his money on the horses and drawn the attention of the IRS as well as a $145,000 debt. Fortunately for Steve the IRS manifests itself in leggy agent Susan Jacks (Nancy Sinatra). All is not lost on the financial front either, as Steve gets some valuable driving tips from former driver Abel Esterlake (William Schallert), which may help him win back the money in the Charlotte 500, and keep himself and his manager out of jail. Features the following songs: “Speedway”, “Let yourself go”, “There aint nothing like a song”, and Nancy Sinatra singing “Your groovy self”. Contains the original theatrical trailer. Cast also includes Gale Gordon, Bill Bixby and Carl Ballantine.

results.title: Speedball for girls
results.brief_description: An introduction to the game of speedball. Explains players’ positions on the field, the rules of the game, techniques in developing team co-operation and individual skills - kicking, juggling, volleying, passing and receiving.

results.title: Speed the scrap [Short version]
results.creator_credit: Frank Green, Ace Films and British Iron and Steel Federation
results.brief_description: Emphasises the fact the Britain is becoming more dependent upon scrap metal to maintain her output of iron and steel. Iron ore deposits in the Midlands and imported ore from Africa provide insufficient supplies for new steel; over half the iron and steel produced in the United Kingdom is made from scrap. shows conversion of scrap to new steel in electric carbon-arc furnaces; by-product of process is slag, used as fertiliser.

results.creator_credit: Allan Crich, Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films, British Petroleum and Bob Privett

results.title: Speed scene: the problem of amphetamine abuse
results.brief_description: Presents evidence against the use of amphetamines in any form other than for medical purposes. Discusses psychological dependency on these drugs and how it often leads to other more dangerous, addictive drugs. Notes the most malignant form of amphetamine, one type of which is called “Speed”.

results.title: Speed of sound
results.creator_credit: Frank Wells, Gaumont-British Instructional and S.G. Fergusson
results.brief_description: Simple demonstrations are used to compare the speed of sound through air and through metal. Methods of determing the speed of sound in air, as determined by the French Academy Commission in 1738, and in water, as determined by Colladon and Sturm in Lake Geneva, are illustrated. Practical applications of the speed of sound are mentioned; the use of sound waves in echo sounding and depth plotting; sound ranging in gun location.

results.title: Speed of light
results.creator_credit: Kevin Smith, Stephen White and Educational Services, Inc.
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PSSC physics”.
Shows the measuring of the speed of light in air at night, using a spark-gap, a photocell, parabolic mirrors and an oscilloscope. Also studies the speed of light in air and water in a laboratory, using a high-speed rotation mirror.
